snippet: Gov. Gray Davis, weighing whether to allow the execution of a convicted killer, has been advised by the Board of Prison Terms to reject a petition for clemency.    ''By a unanimous vote, the board recommends that Mr. Babbitt be denied commutation,...
lead_paragraph: Gov. Gray Davis, weighing whether to allow the execution of a convicted killer, has been advised by the Board of Prison Terms to reject a petition for clemency. ''By a unanimous vote, the board recommends that Mr. Babbitt be denied commutation,'' the panel wrote to Governor Davis in a confidential report obtained today.
abstract: California Board of Prison Terms recommends that Gov Gray Davis reject clemency petition of Manny Babbitt, sentenced to die for 1980 murder of 78-year-old Leah Schendel (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Panel Rejects Clemency For Condemned Killer
